issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
when launch the fifth m1.small instance failed due to no space left issue,but the host has enough space to use.Before this launch, the others four m1.small instance are launched successfully.If we terminate one and re-launch, it is also successful.
the errorlog in nc.log is as below:
2012-12-05 16:30:02 DEBUG 000003689 doDescribeInstances | i-E1E544E3 Pending pub=10.69.152.103 priv=192.168.151.51 mac=D0:0D:E1:E5:44:E3 vlan=606 net=51 plat=linux vols=
2012-12-05 16:30:08 DEBUG 000042501 art_implement_tree | i-E1E544E3 implemented artifact 068|prt-159232ext3-09be6495 on try 1
2012-12-05 16:30:08 DEBUG 000042501 find_or_create_artifact | i-E1E544E3 checking work blobstore for 069|prt-159232ext3-09be6495 (do_create=1 ret=1)
2012-12-05 16:30:08 ERROR 000042501 art_implement_tree | i-E1E544E3 error: failed to allocate artifact prt-159232ext3-09be6495 (8 blobstore.c:2211 no space left) on try 1
2012-12-05 16:30:08 DEBUG 000042501 diskutil_unloop | detaching from loop device /dev/loop21
2012-12-05 16:30:08 DEBUG 000042501 art_implement_tree | i-E1E544E3 error: failed to implement artifact 069|prt-159232ext3-09be6495 on try 1
2012-12-05 16:30:08 ERROR 000042501 art_implement_tree | i-E1E544E3 error: failed to provision dependency prt-159232ext3-09be6495 for artifact dsk-13AA3E5D-9d97f193 (error=8) on try 1
2012-12-05 16:30:08 DEBUG 000042501 art_implement_tree | i-E1E544E3 error: failed to implement artifact 072|dsk-13AA3E5D-9d97f193 on try 1
2012-12-05 16:30:08 ERROR 000042501 art_implement_tree | i-E1E544E3 error: failed to provision dependency dsk-13AA3E5D-9d97f193 for artifact i-E1E544E3 (error=8) on try 1
2012-12-05 16:30:08 DEBUG 000042501 art_implement_tree | i-E1E544E3 error: failed to implement artifact 061|i-E1E544E3 on try 1
2012-12-05 16:30:08 ERROR 000042501 create_instance_backing | i-E1E544E3 error: failed to implement backing for instance
2012-12-05 16:30:08 ERROR 000042501 startup_thread | i-E1E544E3 failed to prepare images for instance (error=1)
2012-12-05 16:30:08 DEBUG 000042501 change_state | i-E1E544E3 state change for instance: Staging -> Shutoff (Pending)

the other configuration information in our environment:
Name CPUs Memory (MB) Disk (GB)
m1.small 1 1740 160

root@NC01 instances# df -h
Filesystem Size Used Avail Use% Mounted on
/dev/mapper/vg00-lvol1
115G 5.1G 104G 5% /
tmpfs 48G 0 48G 0% /dev/shm
/dev/sda1 97M 26M 67M 28% /boot
/dev/mapper/instance-work-instance-work
4.4T 1.1G 4.1T 1% /var/lib/eucalyptus/instances/work
/dev/mapper/instance-cache-instance-cache
962G 14G 900G 2% /var/lib/eucalyptus/instances/cache

root@NC01 instances# du -sh /var/lib/eucalyptus/instances/*
6.6G /var/lib/eucalyptus/instances/cache
848M /var/lib/eucalyptus/instances/work

in eucalyptus.conf:
NC_CACHE_SIZE=1074000
NC_WORK_SIZE=4938700

the cache and work use the local disk by LVM.
fields.summary: launch instance failed due to error: failed to allocate artifact prt-159232ext3-09be6495 (8 blobstore.c:2211 no space left) on try 1

comments.body:
in our euca3.2 release , we found the same issue, a NC just can launch 4 m1.small instance. 
if launch more , NC will report "[i-5EF34456] failed to allocate artifact prt-159232ext3-09be6495 (8 blobstore.c:2266 no space left) on try 1"

Hi Dmitrii

I reproduce this issue in our platform. the info is below:

[root@nc-1 instances]# grep limit /var/log/eucalyptus/nc.log* | tail -6
2013-02-28 17:32:18  INFO 000008599 init                     |                           4823000MB limit (106.1% of the file system) - 94180MB overhead = 4728820MB = 4617GB
2013-02-28 17:32:18  INFO 000008599 init                     |                           025600MB reserved for use (0.5% of limit)
2013-02-28 17:32:18  INFO 000008599 init                     |                           000720MB allocated for use (0.0% of limit, 0.0% of the file system)
2013-02-28 17:32:18  INFO 000008599 init                     |                           1049000MB limit (106.6% of the file system)
2013-02-28 17:32:18  INFO 000008599 init                     |                           035328MB reserved for use (3.4% of limit)
2013-02-28 17:32:18  INFO 000008599 init                     |                           008758MB allocated for use (0.8% of limit, 0.9% of the file system)
[root@nc-1 instances]#

[root@nc-1 instances]#
Hello [~liming] -- Thank you for obtaining the information that I requested. It was helpful! I will get back to your shortly regarding the solution.

This turned out to be a bug. The fix is now in the code and it is targeted for 3.2.2 release. Until then, NC_CACHE_SIZE and NC_WORK_SIZE should not be set above 524287 (yes, effectively limiting storage to ~0.5TB).

Thanks for the detailed report, [~liming], it was helpful for identifying and fixing the problem quickly!

Verified that I could launch instances up to 4TB of work space:

3.2.2 has been released, moving this to Resolved.

verify version:euca3.2.2
step2:
1,euca.conf setting like below:
NC_CACHE_SIZE="1049000"
NC_WORK_SIZE="4823000"
2,modify m1.small instance type, disk size as 160g
3,launch 15 instance in one NC
4,see result
5,terminated instance and launch again ,see result


rest result:
1,instance will launched succesfully, the resource calculation is right
instance number=4617-1897/160=17(see nc.log can get such info)
